intro: Pilea nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepalese pilea, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants commonly known as nettles. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Pilea nepalensis prefers cool, humid environments and is relatively easy to care for in indoor settings.
